intro: Cybistetes longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf cybistetes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and delicate, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
